title: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org
description: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org on GitHub

items.content_html:
In Moodle 2.x and 3.x, an unenrolled user still receives event monitor notifications even though they can no longer access the course.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2016-5014
  • https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=336699
  • https://github.com/moodle/moodle/commit/ea106d2a1dbc633a22f12a119763b2af5f33542b
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20210123154548/http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/92042
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-c4cq-v4wp-28hg

items.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle sensitive information disclosure

items.content_html:
In Moodle 2.x and 3.x, text injection can occur in email headers, potentially leading to outbound spam.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2016-5013
  • https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=336698
  • https://github.com/moodle/moodle/commit/ed63718caa48803843a14140d8a27f04aba9c8c4
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20210123154543/http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/92040
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-2hh3-jmv8-5fmx
items.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle Does Not Escape Characters In Email Headers

items.content_html:
In Moodle 2.x and 3.x, text injection can occur in email headers, potentially leading to outbound spam.

items.content_html:
The capability check to access other badges in Moodle 3.0 through 3.0.3, 2.9 through 2.9.5, 2.8 through 2.8.11, 2.7 through 2.7.13, and earlier allows remote authenticated users to read the badges of other users.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2016-3732
  • https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1335933
  • http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2016/05/17/4
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20210413170947/http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1035902
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-5282-96ff-xx3h
items.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle sensitive information disclosure

items.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle sensitive information disclosure

items.content_html:
The (1) core_enrol_get_course_enrolment_methods and (2) enrol_self_get_instance_info web services in Moodle through 2.6.11, 2.7.x before 2.7.12, 2.8.x before 2.8.10, 2.9.x before 2.9.4, and 3.0.x before 3.0.2 do not consider the moodle/course:viewhiddencourses capability, which allows remote authenticated users to obtain sensitive information via a web-service request.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2016-0724
  • https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=326205
  • http://git.moodle.org/gw?p=moodle.git&a=search&h=HEAD&st=commit&s=MDL-52072
  • http://lists.fedoraproject.org/pipermail/package-announce/2016-February/176502.html
  • http://lists.fedoraproject.org/pipermail/package-announce/2016-January/176436.html
  • http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2016/01/18/1
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20210622172957/http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1034694
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-hjrj-7wcj-7j3c
items.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle sensitive information disclosure

items.content_html:
The (1) core_enrol_get_course_enrolment_methods and (2) enrol_self_get_instance_info web services in Moodle through 2.6.11, 2.7.x before 2.7.12, 2.8.x before 2.8.10, 2.9.x before 2.9.4, and 3.0.x before 3.0.2 do not consider the moodle/course:viewhiddencourses capability, which allows remote authenticated users to obtain sensitive information via a web-service request.

items.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle sensitive information disclosure

items.content_html:
Moodle through 2.6.11, 2.7.x before 2.7.13, 2.8.x before 2.8.11, 2.9.x before 2.9.5, and 3.0.x before 3.0.3 does not properly restrict links, which allows remote attackers to obtain sensitive URL information by reading a Referer log.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2016-2190
  • https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=330181
  • http://git.moodle.org/gw?p=moodle.git&a=search&h=HEAD&st=commit&s=MDL-52651
  • http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2016/03/21/1
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20210801130148/http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1035333
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-r9pc-g29w-f86j
items.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle sensitive information disclosure

items.content_html:
Moodle through 2.6.11, 2.7.x before 2.7.13, 2.8.x before 2.8.11, 2.9.x before 2.9.5, and 3.0.x before 3.0.3 does not properly restrict links, which allows remote attackers to obtain sensitive URL information by reading a Referer log.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2016-2190
  • https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=330181
